title: Quiz 5: Community Nutrition
description: Assess knowledge on community nutrition programs, dietary habits, and disease prevention.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of community nutrition?

options.text: To provide free food to everyone
To help individuals and groups develop healthy eating habits to prevent disease
To enforce strict diets on the population

questions.explanation: The main goal is promotion of wellness and prevention of disease through healthy eating habits.

questions.question: The '5-A-Day' public awareness promotion urges the public to eat at least five ___BLANK___ and ___BLANK___ every day.
questions.explanation: 5-A-Day refers to 5 servings of fruits and vegetables.
questions.hint: They are the healthiest food groups.

questions.question: Which of the following are common target groups for community nutrition programs? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Community nutrition targets vulnerable groups across the lifespan, including all listed options.
questions.hint: All these groups have specific nutritional needs.

questions.question: Community nutrition programs are exclusively for people who cannot afford food.
questions.explanation: False. While some programs address poverty, community nutrition aims to educate ALL individuals (e.g., regarding obesity, diabetes) regardless of income.
questions.hint: Does a wealthy person with diabetes need nutritional education?

questions.question: Match the nutrition-related issue with the affected group/cause:

pairs.right: Availability of fast food and lack of exercise
Loss of interest in eating due to loneliness
Unhealthy cafeteria choices like fries and soda

questions.explanation: These are specific examples of nutritional challenges faced by different demographics.
questions.hint: Seniors often eat alone; children eat at school.

questions.question: What is the term for a person's access to healthy food, often addressed by community coalitions?
questions.explanation: Food security refers to having reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable, nutritious food.
questions.hint: It involves being 'secure' in getting food.

questions.question: Read the case study excerpt below. What was a key objective of the Shasta County strategic plan?

richContent.content: Shasta County Plan: Projects included obesity prevention, breastfeeding education, and a goal to increase residents eating 5 servings of fruits/vegetables from 26% to 40%.

options.text: To ban all fast food restaurants

questions.explanation: The plan specifically targeted raising the percentage of residents eating 5-a-day to 40%.
questions.hint: Look at the numbers in the text.

questions.question: Order the steps in the process of a typical community nutrition program:
questions.explanation: You assess needs first, then implement the program, expect change, and follow up.
